message_2:
To simplify the given rational expression, we can first factor out the common factors in both the numerator and the denominator.

Numerator: 4x^2 + 12x
Factor out the common factor 4x:
4x(x + 3)

Denominator: 2x^2 - 6x
Factor out the common factor 2x:
2x(x - 3)

Now, the rational expression becomes:

(4x(x + 3)) / (2x(x - 3))

Next, we can simplify the expression by cancelling out the common factor 2x:

(2 * 2x(x + 3)) / (2x(x - 3))

(2x(x + 3)) / (x(x - 3))

The simplified rational expression is:

2(x + 3) / (x - 3)
